question: How do I configure a static IP address on Arch Linux using systemd-networkd?

golden_answer.summary: Create a .network file in /etc/systemd/network/ with interface match and network configuration, then restart systemd-networkd service.
steps: Identify your network interface name: ip link
Create a network configuration file: sudo nano /etc/systemd/network/20-wired.network
Enable systemd-networkd: sudo systemctl enable systemd-networkd
Restart systemd-networkd: sudo systemctl restart systemd-networkd
warnings: Backup existing network configuration before making changes
Ensure systemd-networkd doesn't conflict with NetworkManager (disable NetworkManager if using systemd-networkd)
Wrong IP configuration can lock you out of remote systems
